discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The IS quality assurance (QA) group is responsible for evaluating the quality of the information systems and ensuring that they meet established standards. This includes reviewing and testing program changes to ensure that they adhere to established standards, policies, and procedures. The QA group is also responsible for identifying and reporting any deficiencies or weaknesses in the system.
C. ensuring that program changes adhere to established standards

Selected Answer: C
Answer: C

Selected Answer: C
C for me

Selected Answer: C
QA deals with processes

Selected Answer: C
C. ensuring that program changes adhere to established standards.

The IS quality assurance (QA) group is responsible for ensuring that program changes adhere to established standards. This involves reviewing and validating any modifications made to software, applications, or systems to ensure that they follow predefined guidelines, best practices, and quality benchmarks. The QA group's role is to maintain consistency and quality throughout the software development or system maintenance process.

Selected Answer: C
Choice D is the
responsibility of the data control group. Its C

According to CRM the QA program and respective policies , procedures, and processes are encompassed within a planned and systematic pattern of all actions necessary to provide adequate confidence that an item or product conform to established technical requirement.So C can be correct

Selected Answer: D
It sounds like the answer should be D

Selected Answer: D
Answer should be D. Because the function of the quality assurance team is to ensure the integrity and reliability of the operation of the information system, and compliance with the established standards after the project is changed is also one of the functions of the quality assurance team, but the scope is smaller, so D will be a better answer.
Answer should be D

questions.question_text: The IS quality assurance (QA) group is responsible for:

choices.D: ensuring that the output received from system processing is complete.
choices.A: monitoring the execution of computer processing tasks.
choices.C: ensuring that program changes adhere to established standards.
choices.B: designing procedures to protect data against accidental disclosure.

discussion.content: C. Number of API calls expected versus actually received within a time interval

questions.question_text: Which of the following metrics would be MOST useful to an IS auditor when assessing the resilience of an application programming interface (API)?

choices.C: Number of API calls expected versus actually received within a time interval
choices.D: Number of developers adopting the API for their applications
choices.B: Number of defects logged during development compared to other APIs
choices.A: Number of patches released within a time interval for the API

choices.C: Rate changes require visual verification before acceptance.
choices.B: Rate changes are reported to and independently verified by a manager.
choices.A: Rate changes must be entered twice to ensure that they are entered correctly.
choices.D: Only a payroll department manager can input the new rate.

questions.question_text: Which of the following controls would BEST ensure that payroll system rate changes are valid?

discussion.content: B. Rate changes are reported to and independently verified by a manager.

questions.question_text: Which of the following testing methods is MOST appropriate for assessing whether system integrity has been maintained after changes have been made?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
its B.

Selected Answer: B
https://www.simform.com/blog/regression-testing/#:~:text=Regression%20testing%20is%20a%20type,or%20updating%20a%20current%20feature.

Regression testing is a type of testing where you can verify that the changes made in the codebase do not impact the existing software functionality. For example, these code changes could include adding new features, fixing bugs, or updating a current feature.
should be B

Selected Answer: A
should be A

choices.D: Determination of IP range in use

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
While determining the IP range in use is also important, identifying existing nodes provides a more granular understanding of the network's composition and is therefore often considered the MOST important aspect when planning a network audit.
I believe its B
D. Determination of IP range in use
